_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



    R L Adams Plastics Inc. located at 5955 Cross Roads Commerce Wyoming, MI is committed to a safe work place for our employees and committed to being good stewards of our environment and community.

R L Adams Plastics Inc is a producer of polystyrene foam using Difluoroethane and Isopentane to produce various products using tandem extrusion lines. The extruded product is in sheet form. This sheet is converted into various products.



    Difluoroethane and Isopentane are delivered to R L Adams Plastics via tanker truck. The driver has to sign in and be approved for delivery. The Difluoroethane and Isopentane are unloaded using a truck mounted pump to the aboveground tank with maximum quantity of 45,000 lbs. and 56000 lbs. (respectively) in a secured tank farm using a vapor recovery system that prevents the release of vapors. The truck is bonded to the earth ground to prevent sparks. The driver must be qualified and trained in the safe handling of this product. The driver must be with the truck continuously throughout the unloading procedure. 



    1.     R.L. Adams Plastics Inc. works closely with the City of Wyoming Fire Department for the process information and updates of changes. The Wyoming Fire Department is our first responder.



    2.     R.L. Adams Plastics Inc. insures the safe handling of Difluoroethane and Isopentane using various procedures. (Including but not limited to)

    

        A. Training for the safe practices of Difluoroethane and Isopentane, this includes all new employees, also annual reviews with all employees, and updates on a continuing basis.

  

        B. The use of monitoring equipment to ensure that safe levels of Difluoroethane and Isopentane are maintained. The use of FID ?flame ionized detectors? hand held monitor for actual PPM testing. Permanent mounted gas detection system that monitors the PPM and automatically calls from emergency telephone call list at specific alarm levels. The use of hand held gas detectors at the beginning

of each shift. In addition, the use of hand held monitors for the maintenance department?s use in hot work permits.



    4. The Worse case scenario was calculated using RMP Comp

        The largest release of Difluoroethane possible would be the total contents of the 45,000 lbs. in the tank that would be in a vapor cloud 138 lbs. / min. The Difluoroethane would vaporize at a rate of 1380 lbs in ten minutes. It is assumed that an ignition source would ignite this vapor cloud causing an explosion. Estimated distance to 1psi. over-pressure: is .2 miles. Assumptions made are wind speed of 3.4 MPH and a temperature of 77? F. 











    4. The Worse case scenario was calculated using RMP Comp

        The largest release of Isopentane possible would be the total contents of the 56,000 lbs. in the tank that would spill into the secondary containment dike and pool at a rate of 115lbs. / min. This pool would vaporize at a rate of 1150 lbs in ten minutes. It is assumed that an ignition source would ignite this vapor cloud causing an explosion. Estimated distance to 1psi. over-pressure: is .08 miles. Assumptions made are wind speed of 3.4 MPH and a temperature of 77? F. 







    6. The general accidental release prevention program and specific chemical              prevention.

        The overall safety program at R.L. Adams Plastics Inc. begins with management commitment to the overall safe practices and polices to protect our employees and community. This facility has specific safety procedures and policies that directly relate to Difluoroethane and Isopentane are strictly enforced. Starting with training of new employees at orientation to annual training of all employees and updates as needed of Difluoroethane and Isopentane safety and right to know. Strict zero tolerance no smoking and open flame policies are in effect. Using only trained and qualified personnel in the transportation and delivery of Difluoroethane and Isopentane.  The permanently mounted gas leak - detection systems with conti

nuous monitoring, and test procedures that are done at each shift of operation to forewarn of possible leak potentials. Control measures are taken from the storage of Difluoroethane and Isopentane through the end process.















    7.  Five year accident history. 

        This facility has not had a recordable accident in the past five years.



    





    8. Emergency response program.

        The local fire department is our first responder and has been informed of Difluoroethane storage and use in our process. The local fire department performs inspections, training and ?trial runs? with the full cooperation of R. L .Adams Plastics. This relationship with the local fire department has been used as the standard for industry in the city.
